PGpolynomialmacros.pl

00001 
00002 =head1 PGpolynomialmacros.pl DESCRIPTION
00003 
00004  ##########################################################
00005  #  It contains rountines used to create and manipulate  ##
00006  #  polynomials for WeBWorK                              ##
00007  #                                                       ##
00008  #  Copyright 2002 Mark Schmitt                          ##
00009  #  Version 1.1.2                                        ##
00010  ##########################################################
00011 
00012  #  In the current version, there is no attempt to verify that correct arrays are being passed to the routines.
00013  #  This ought to be changed in the next incarnation.
00014  #  It is assumed that arrays passed to the routines have no leading zeros, and represent the coefficients of
00015  #  a polynomial written in standard form using place-holding zeros.
00016  #  This means $array[0] is the leading coefficient of the polynomial and $array[$#array] is the constant term.
00017  #
00018  #  The routines were written based on the needs of my Honors Algebra 2 course.  The following algorithms have been
00019  #  coded:
00020  #      Polynomial Multiplication
00021  #      Polynomial Long Division
00022  #      Polynomial Synthetic Division (mainly as a support routine for checking bounds on roots)
00023  #      Finding the least positive integral upper bounds for roots
00024  #      Finding the greatest negative integral lower bounds for roots
00025  #      Descartes' Rule of Signs for the maximum number of positive and negative roots
00026  #      Stringification : converting an array of coefficients into a properly formatted polynomial string
00027  #      Polynomial Addition
00028  #      Polynomial Subtraction
00029 
00030 =cut
00031 
00032 =head3 ValidPoly(@PolynomialCoeffs)
00033 
00034 =cut
00035 
00036 sub ValidPoly {
00037     my $xref = @_;
00038     if (${$xref}[0] != 0) {return 1;}
00039     else {return 0;}
00040 }
00041 
00042 =head3 PolyAdd(@Polyn1,@Polyn2)
00043 
00044 #
00045 # Takes two arrays of polynomial coefficients representing 
00046 # two polynomials and returns their sum.
00047 #
00048 
00049 =cut
00050 
00051 sub PolyAdd{
00052     my ($xref,$yref) = @_;
00053     @local_x = @{$xref};
00054     @local_y = @{$yref};
00055     if ($#local_x < $#local_y) {
00056     while ($#local_x < $#local_y) {unshift @local_x, 0;}
00057     }
00058     elsif ($#local_y < $#local_x) {
00059     while ($#local_y < $#local_x) {unshift @local_y, 0;}
00060     }
00061     foreach $i (0..$#local_x) {
00062         $sum[$i] = $local_x[$i] + $local_y[$i];
00063     }
00064     return @sum;
00065 }
00066 
00067 =head3 PolySub(@Polyn1,@Polyn2)
00068 
00069 #
00070 # Takes two arrays of polynomial coefficients representing 
00071 # two polynomials and returns their difference.
00072 #
00073 
00074 =cut
00075 
00076 sub PolySub{
00077     my ($xref,$yref) = @_;
00078     @local_x = @{$xref};
00079     @local_y = @{$yref};
00080     if ($#local_x < $#local_y) {
00081         while ($#local_x < $#local_y) {unshift @local_x, 0;}
00082     }
00083     elsif ($#local_y < $#local_x) {
00084     while ($#local_y < $#local_x) {unshift @local_y, 0;}
00085     }
00086     foreach $i (0..$#local_x) {
00087         $diff[$i] = $local_x[$i] - $local_y[$i];
00088     }
00089     return @diff;
00090 }

00092 =head3 PolyMult(~~@coefficientArray1,~~@coefficientArray2)
00093 
00094 #
00095 # Accepts two arrays containing coefficients in descending order
00096 # returns an array with the coefficients of the product
00097 #
00098 
00099 =cut
00100 
00101 sub PolyMult{
00102     my ($xref,$yref) = @_;
00103     @local_x = @{$xref};
00104     @local_y = @{$yref};
00105     foreach $i (0..$#local_x + $#local_y) {$result[$i] = 0;}
00106     foreach $i (0..$#local_x) {
00107         foreach $j (0..$#local_y) {
00108            $result[$i+$j] = $result[$i+$j]+$local_x[$i]*$local_y[$j];
00109         }
00110     }
00111     return @result;
00112 }
00113 
00114 =head3 (@quotient,$remainder) = SynDiv(~~@dividend,~~@divisor)
00115 
00116 #
00117 # Performs synthetic division on two polynomials returning 
00118 # the quotient and remainder in an array.
00119 #
00120 
00121 =cut
00122 
00123 sub SynDiv{
00124     my ($dividendref,$divisorref)=@_;
00125     my @dividend = @{$dividendref};
00126     my @divisor = @{$divisorref};
00127     my @quotient;
00128     $quotient[0] = $dividend[0];
00129     foreach $i (1..$#dividend) {
00130         $quotient[$i] = $dividend[$i]-$quotient[$i-1]*$divisor[1];
00131     }
00132     return @quotient;
00133 }
00134 
00135 =head3 (@quotient,@remainder) = LongDiv($dividendref,$divisorref)
00136 
00137 #
00138 # Performs long division on two polynomials
00139 # returning the quotient and remainder
00140 #
00141 
00142 =cut
00143 
00144 sub LongDiv{
00145     my ($dividendref,$divisorref)=@_;
00146     my @dividend = @{$dividendref};
00147     my @divisor = @{$divisorref};
00148     my @quotient; my @remainder;
00149     foreach $i (0..$#dividend-$#divisor) {
00150       $quotient[$i] = $dividend[$i]/$divisor[0];
00151       foreach $j (1..$#divisor) {
00152         $dividend[$i+$j] = $dividend[$i+$j] - $quotient[$i]*$divisor[$j];
00153       }
00154     }
00155     foreach $i ($#dividend-$#divisor+1..$#dividend) {
00156         $remainder[$i-($#dividend-$#divisor+1)] = $dividend[$i];
00157     }
00158     return (\@quotient,\@remainder);
00159 }

00164 =head3 UpBound(~~@polynomial)
00165 
00166 #
00167 # Accepts a reference to an array containing the coefficients, in descending
00168 #   order, of a polynomial.
00169 #
00170 # Returns the lowest positive integral upper bound to the roots of the
00171 #   polynomial.
00172 #
00173 
00174 =cut
00175 
00176 
00177 sub UpBound {
00178     my $polyref=$_[0];
00179     my @poly = @{$polyref};
00180     my $bound = 0;
00181     my $test = 0;
00182     while ($test < @poly) {
00183         $bound++;
00184         $test=0;
00185         @div = (1,-$bound);
00186         @result = &SynDiv(\@poly,\@div);
00187         foreach $i (0..$#result) {
00188            if (sgn($result[$i])==sgn($result[0]) || $result[$i]==0) {
00189                 $test++;
00190            }
00191         }
00192     }
00193     return $bound;
00194 }
00195 
00196 
00197 
00198 =head3 LowBound(~~@polynomial)
00199 
00200 #
00201 # Accepts a reference to an array containing the coefficients, in descending
00202 #   order, of a polynomial.
00203 #
00204 # Returns the greatest negative integral lower bound to the roots of the
00205 #   polynomial
00206 #
00207 
00208 =cut
00209 
00210 sub LowBound {
00211     my $polyref=$_[0];
00212     my @poly = @{$polyref};
00213     my $bound = 0;
00214     my $test = 0;
00215     while ($test == 0) {
00216         $test = 1; $bound = $bound-1;
00217         @div = (1,-$bound);
00218         @res = &SynDiv(\@poly,\@div);
00219         foreach $i (1..int(($#res -1)/2)) {
00220             if (sgn($res[0])*sgn($res[2*$i]) == -1) {
00221             $test = 0;}
00222         }
00223         foreach $i (1..int($#res/2)) {
00224             if (sgn($res[0])*sgn($res[2*$i-1]) == 1) {
00225             $test = 0;}
00226         }
00227     }
00228     return $bound;
00229 }

00232 =head3 PolyString(~~@coefficientArray,x)
00233 
00234 #
00235 # Accepts an array containing the coefficients of a polynomial
00236 #   in descending order
00237 # Returns a sting containing the polynomial with variable x
00238 # Default variable is x
00239 #
00240 
00241 =cut
00242 
00243 sub PolyString{
00244     my $temp = $_[0];
00245     my @poly = @{$temp};
00246     my $string = '';
00247     foreach my $i (0..$#poly) {
00248         my $j = $#poly-$i;
00249         if ($j == $#poly) {
00250             if ($poly[$i] >0) {
00251                 if ($poly[$i]!=1){
00252                     $string = $string."$poly[$i] x^{$j}";
00253                 }
00254                 else {$string=$string."x^{$j}";}
00255             }
00256             elsif ($poly[$i] == 0) {}
00257             elsif ($poly[$i] == -1) {$string=$string."-x^{$j}";}
00258             else {$string = $string."$poly[$i] x^{$j}";}    
00259         }
00260         elsif ($j > 0 && $j!=1) {
00261             if ($poly[$i] >0) {
00262                 if ($poly[$i]!=1){
00263                     $string = $string."+$poly[$i] x^{$j}";
00264                 }
00265                 else {$string = $string."+x^{$j}";}}
00266             elsif ($poly[$i] == 0) {}
00267             elsif ($poly[$i] == -1) {$string=$string."-x^{$j}";}
00268             else {$string = $string."$poly[$i] x^{$j}";}
00269         }
00270         elsif ($j == 1) {
00271             if ($poly[$i] > 0){
00272                 if ($poly[$i]!=1){
00273                     $string = $string."+$poly[$i] x";
00274                 }
00275                 else {$string = $string."+x";}
00276             }
00277             elsif ($poly[$i] == 0) {}
00278             elsif ($poly[$i] == -1){$string=$string."-x";}
00279             else {$string=$string."$poly[$i] x";}
00280         }
00281         else {
00282             if ($poly[$i] > 0){
00283                 $string = $string."+$poly[$i] ";
00284             }
00285             elsif ($poly[$i] == 0) {}
00286             else {$string=$string."$poly[$i] ";}
00287         }
00288     }
00289     return $string;
00290 }
00291 
00292 
00293 sub PolyFunc {
00294     my $temp = $_[0];
00295     my @poly = @{$temp};
00296     $func = "";
00297     foreach $i (0..$#poly) {
00298         $j = $#poly-$i;
00299         if ($poly[$i] > 0) {$func = $func."+$poly[$i]*x**($j)";}
00300         else {$func = $func."$poly[$i]*x**($j)";}
00301     }
00302     return $func;
00303 }
00304 
00305 =head3 ($maxpos,$maxneg) = Descartes(~~@poly)
00306 
00307 #
00308 # Accepts an array containing the coefficients, in descending order, of a
00309 #  polynomial
00310 # Returns the maximum number of positive and negative roots according to
00311 #  Descartes Rule of Signs
00312 #
00313 # IMPORTANT NOTE:  this function currently does not accept coefficients of
00314 #  zero.
00315 #
00316 
00317 =cut
00318 
00319 sub Descartes {
00320     my $temp = $_[0];
00321     my @poly = @{$temp};
00322     my $pos = 0; my $neg = 0;
00323     foreach $i (1..$#poly) {
00324         if (sgn($poly[$i])*sgn($poly[$i-1]) == -1) {$pos++;}
00325         elsif (sgn($poly[$i])*sgn($poly[$i-1]) == 1) {$neg++;}
00326     }
00327     return ($pos,$neg);
00328 }
